Description: Rim and body fragment of North Ionian pottery plate with offset horizontal ledge rim; root of ring foot preserved; exterior: pink slip, paint fired orange: two groups of horizontal lines; interior: buff slip, dark brown paint; chain of lotus-flower and buds with zone of tongues (?) below; rim pattern: paired hook meander; row of blobs on the outer surface of the rim.
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by the Ashmolean Museum, Oxford. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.
Bibliographic references: Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GG.726)
Previous owner: Currently owned by: Ashmolean Museum, University of Oxford
Acquisition notes: The Ashmolean Museum register records not findspot for this piece, but since the type of vessel is frequent at Naukratis a provenance of Naukratis cannot be excluded.
